SEARCH
Module com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame
Package com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame.Controllers

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame.Controllers.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class manages the main game logic for the Snake Game. It handles game initialization, the main game loop, snake movement, and game state updates. The class is responsible for integrating the game model, view, and handling user inputs.
Author:
Dominion Aromolaran-modified (GameFrame)

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      public void initialise(GameView view, SnakeModel smodel, FoodModel fmodel, GameModel gmodel)
      Initializes the game controller with necessary components. Sets up the view, models, and creates the game scene.
      Parameters:
      view - The GameView component of the game.
      smodel - The SnakeModel representing the player's snake.
      fmodel - The FoodModel representing the food in the game.
      gmodel - The GameModel containing game settings and state.

    • startGameLoop

      public void startGameLoop(javafx.stage.Stage stage, boolean replay) throws IOException
      Starts the game loop. This method sets up the scene, initializes game elements, and begins the main game loop.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage on which the game is displayed.
      replay - Indicates whether this is a new game or a replay.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during game setup.

    • Loop

      public void Loop()
      Main loop of the game that handles updates to the game state. Checks the snake's life status, updates the game view, and manages the food consumption.

    • setTheme

      public void setTheme(int theme)
      Sets the theme of the game based on the selected option. The theme influences the visual appearance of the game.
      Parameters:
      theme - An integer representing the chosen theme.

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel(int level)
      Sets the difficulty level of the game. The level determines the speed of the snake and points gained per food item.
      Parameters:
      level - An integer representing the chosen difficulty level.

    • handleKeyPressed

      public void handleKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event, SnakeModel snakeModel)
      Handles key press events to control the snake's movement and other game actions. Changes the direction of the snake based on arrow key inputs and pauses the game if the space bar is pressed. Pauses the game if pause is pressed
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent representing the key pressed.
      snakeModel - The SnakeModel representing the player's snake.

    • move

      public void move()
      Updates the position of the snake based on its current direction. Called on every frame to move the snake in the game.

    • checkOutOfBounds

      public void checkOutOfBounds()
      Checks if the snake has moved out of the game bounds. If the snake has moved out, its alive status is set to false.

    • checkSelfCollision

      public void checkSelfCollision()
      Checks for collisions between the snake and itself. If a self-collision is detected, sets the snake's alive status to false.

    • checkBombCollision

      public void checkBombCollision()
      Checks for collisions between the snake and bombs on higher difficulty levels. If a collision with a bomb is detected, sets the snake's alive status to false.

    • isSnakeAlive

      public void isSnakeAlive()
      Checks if the snake is still alive by evaluating collision conditions. Updates the game state based on the snake's alive status.

    • adjustXWithinBounds

      public int adjustXWithinBounds(int newX)
      Adjusts the snake's X position to ensure it remains within game bounds. This is used for the explosion animation.
      Parameters:
      newX - The new X position of the snake.
      Returns:
      The adjusted X position, constrained within game bounds.

    • adjustYWithinBounds

      public int adjustYWithinBounds(int newY)
      Adjusts the snake's Y position to ensure it remains within game bounds. This is used for the explosion animation.
      Parameters:
      newY - The new Y position of the snake.
      Returns:
      The adjusted Y position, constrained within game bounds.

    • checkIfFoodEaten

      public void checkIfFoodEaten()
      Checks if the snake has eaten food. If the snake's head intersects with the food, the food is marked as eaten, and the snake grows.

    • playMusic

      public void playMusic()
      Initiates the background music for the game.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the game loop and displays the pause menu.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the game loop from a paused state.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game to its initial state.

    • replay

      public void replay(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Starts a new game loop, typically used for replaying the game.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage on which the game is displayed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during game setup.

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()
      Stops the background music if it is playing.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Closes the game application.

    • effects

      public boolean effects()
      Checks if sound effects are enabled in the game settings.
      Returns:
      true if sound effects are enabled, false otherwise.

    • mainMenu

      public void mainMenu(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Transitions to the main menu scene.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage on which the main menu is displayed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during scene transition.
